intro: Verbascum dalamanicum, commonly known as the Dalaman mullein, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
